meanings.definition: To make a silly mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I always seem to goof up my math homework.
meanings.sent2: Don't goof around when you're doing something important.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor would goof intentionally to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: She didn't want to goof and ruin her chances of winning the game.
meanings.sent5: Make sure you double-check your work so you don't goof and get the wrong answer.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a goof and forget your lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: He's always the class goof, making everyone laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent3: The goof in the movie provided comic relief with his clumsy antics.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a goof after tripping over her own feet in front of everyone.
meanings.sent5: The goof at the party kept everyone entertained with his funny stories.

meanings.sent1: Their little goofs often resulted in giggles and smiles.
meanings.sent2: The children's goofs brightened up the dull afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The playful goof of hiding their friend's backpack made them all laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mischievous goofs kept the group entertained during the camping trip.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected goof of switching the teacher's markers caused a lot of laughter in class.
